dialogues.text: Certainly. The salesperson pulls out a GLITTERY BRACELET. Jewel takes it and tries it on. SALESWOMAN (CONT’D) It looks beautiful with that jacket. Jewel looks at herself in the little circular mirror on t counter, and then turns to Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: JEWEL
dialogues.text: What do you think? Forrest looks at it, pursing his lips as if forming an opinion. Then he notices that the salewoman has turned aw momentarily to help another customer...

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: Here, step over here, let me see it in the light... Jewel takes two steps away from the counter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buff Rev. (5/8/17) 54F. ...at which point Forrest takes her hand and PULLS HER AW They BEGIN TO WALK. And they keep walking. Around the corner, casually, Forre setting the pace. Arm in arm. OUT OF the store... They make it the exit of the department store... .+.into the rest of the mall. It’s busy. The other shoppe pay them no mind. By this point, Jewel no longer looks aghast. She’s gone f shocked to paranoid to excited... .+.to happy. She laughs. Giggling to herself, biting her tongue, and then laughing again in spite of herself. She skips forward suddenly, taking the lead, pumping full adrenaline. But then she STOPS. She looks at all the people passing. Forrest stops with her. She looks at him, and then wordle turns back towards the jewelry store. The two of them walk back the way they came. Jewel’s pace more decisive, less anxious. She glances up at Forrest an meets her gaze. He's got a pretty good idea what she’s thinking. They make it all the way back to the counter at the store Jewel gets the attention of the sales clerk as she unfast the bracelet.

dialogues.speaker: JEWEL
dialogues.text: Excuse me, ma’am? I’m sorry...I wasn’t thinking, I just walked off without...

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: oh!

dialogues.speaker: JEWEL
dialogues.text: I'll take it, though. Another glance at Forrest. He chuckles, and pulls out his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: How much? Jewel beams.  Yellow Rev. (4/4/17)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: coe  Buff Rev. (5/8/17) 58. 100 INT. FORREST’S HOUSE - DAY 100 Forrest just entering the house when the TELEPHONE rings.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: Hello? Waller’s voice comes through on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: WALLER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey. It’s me.  Buff Rev. (5/8/17) 58. 100 INT. FORREST’S HOUSE - DAY 100 Forrest just entering the house when the TELEPHONE rings.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: Hello? Waller’s voice comes through on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: WALLER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey. It’s me.  Pink Rev. (3/24/17)

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: You can’t call here.

dialogues.speaker: WALLER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: WALLER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: In Baja.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: How is it?

dialogues.speaker: WALLER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I hate it. There’s too much fucking sunshine. (beat) Listen, have you heard from Teddy?

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: WALLER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: +. .Okay.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: Should I have?

dialogues.speaker: WALLER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Probably nothing. I dropped him in San Antone. He got himself a car and was gonna meet me here on Monday. Now it’s Friday and he hasn't shown up. (beat) So you haven't heard from him.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: WALLER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay. If you do tell him...I don’t know, tell him I’m going to San Miguel. And if he doesn’t find me there, he’s on his own. (beat) Okay?

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: Okay. 59.  Green Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 60.

dialogues.speaker: WALLER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, bud. I won’t call again.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: Enjoy the sunshine.

dialogues.speaker: WALLER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ill try. He hangs up. So does Forrest. 101 INT. CAPTAIN’S OFFICE - POLICE STATION - DAY 101 In the CAPTAIN'S OFFICE, John Hunt is being dressed down.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: You're moving me to homicide?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CALDER
dialogues.text: Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Yeah, but...

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN CALDER
dialogues.text: No buts. Got too many buts already today. Nothin’ but buts. Think of it as a step up.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: To what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Hunt is packing up his desk. Lt. Kelly watches from other side of the desk

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLEY
dialogues.text: Don’t look so sad, man. I’1l be xight down the hall if you need me. Except when I’m out having fun. Having car chases. Wearing disguises. All our usual stuff. But I'll come visit you all the time. I'll send you letters. Christmas Cards. Valentines... John Hunt grabs a stack of mail. There’s a YELLOW ENVELOP amongst it, the kind you’d send a birthday card in. His n is written neatly across the front.  Green Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 60A. He slits the envelope open and slides a letter out. But with it comes a PHOTOGRAPH, which flutters to the flo He bends to pick it up and freezes. The photograph is of FORREST TUCKER.  103 104

dialogues.speaker: 105A
dialogues.text: 105 Green Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 61. Younger, smiling, posing for the camera with a woman and baby, but unmistakably him. The same guy he saw in the ba John Hunt is electrified. He looks around to see if anyone else has seen this. Lt. Kelly isn’t really paying attention.

dialogues.speaker: LT. KELLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: +. mothing... He leans over in his chair. Looking CLOSER at that pictur The sound of an AIRPLANE fades in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AIRPLANE touches down at the San Francisco Internation Airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Hunt sits in the back of a cab, watching a new city drift by. The envelope is in his hand. EXT. DOROTHY’S HOUSE - DAY 105A, The cab pulls up to a tall blue house. John Hunt gets out He goes to the door and knocks. ‘A WOMAN answers. In her 30s. Her name is...

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Dorothy? INT. DOROTHY’S HOUSE - DAY 105 That picture of Forrest now sits on a KITCHEN TABLE. On one side of the table is John Hunt. On the other is a Dorothy. There is a little boy (ROBBIE, 4) playing in the backgrou

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: You mind if I record this?  Green Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 61a.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: No, go ahead. He presses the red button on a tape recorder. The wheels begin turning.  Green Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 62.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Okay. Sorry, keep going.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: He and my mom were only together for two years. I never met him, that I can recall. By the time I was born he was in prison. My brother says he remembers him a little bit but...I don’t know if he does or he just thinks he does. You hear a story and you see a picture and you put the two together and... (beat) She told us all sorts of stories about him and they never really added up, but we were kids so...if he was sailing the high seas one year and off to war the next it really didn’t make any difference. That was just dad. He was off doing stuff and someday he’d come back to see us. But then when I was fifteen, I guess he was gonna get paroled so she sat us down and told us the truth, just in case he ever came looking for us. Which he never did. So... She shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Never called or wrote?

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Nope. I mean, he might not even know I exist, for all I know.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: And he’s a grandpa.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Yep. Guess he is.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: What’s his name?

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: That’s Robbie. You want to come say hi Robbie?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: I got a little boy about his age.  Goldenrod Rev. (4/30/17) 63.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: So are you gonna catch him?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: I'm working on it.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: If you do - I don’t want to see him or have to come in to pick him out of a lineup. Is that okay?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: I didn’t expect you to come all the way here or anything. I just saw the drawing in the paper and thought: well, that looks like my dad. And I think he should be locked up. Mama said, he’d always tell her, oh, I’m a changed-man. But then he’d always get out and go do it all over again. And again. And again. And even after all that - she loved him til the day she died. (beat) But he just looked the other way. You know? HOLD ON Dorothy's face. 106 INT. MARIN COUNTY DA’S OFFICE - AFTERNOON 106 An ASSISTANT DA (STEPHEN BECKLEY, JR. ESQUIRE III) leads through an office, mostly closed for the afternoon. He's carrying a BIG CARDBOARD BOX.

dialogues.speaker: BECKLEY
dialogues.text: I've hung onto all this ever since I represented him. Figured I might write a book about it someday...or just tell my grandkids. He makes for a good story any way you tell it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 107 INT. MARIN COUNTY DA’S OFFICE - MOMENTS LATER 107 That cardboard box SLAMS DOWN on a desk. A label on top o reads TUCKER, FORREST.

dialogues.speaker: AHHH RH
dialogues.text: Goldenrod Rev. (4/30/17) 63a. He opens the box, pulls out a file and sets it down in fr of John. John Hunt opens the file. Staring back at him, is Forrest Tucker’s face, in mug-shot form.  108 109 Goldenrod Rev. (4/30/17) 64.

dialogues.speaker: BECKLEY
dialogues.text: That the man you're looking for?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: I believe it is. He shuffles through the files, making his way backwards.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bicycle theft. Age 13. He got an early start.

dialogues.speaker: BECKLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Spent his whole life locked up. Except for the times he broke out. Back to the present, as John Hunt finds a picture of loca law enforcement gathered around the Rub-A-Dub-Dub. BECKLEY (CONT’D) Sixteen successful escapes and a whole bunch more that were less didn’t work out quite so well. He’1l tell you all about ‘em you ever meet him. He’ll tell you every detail of every adventure he’s ever had, and probably some he didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ROAR of the open road. Yellow stripes zooming down the middle of the road. The s image we glimpsed before. A gray 1955 CHEVY races down the blacktop. Open fields on sides. INT. MARIN COUNTY DA’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS 109 Back to the present.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Sounds like he wasted a lot of opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: BECKLEY
dialogues.text: Well, find something that makes you happy...  Goldenrod Rev. (4/30/17) 64a. Hunt keeps going. One mug-shot after another, each one a younger. It’s like he’s time traveling backwards through Forrest's life...  110 il Goldenrod Rev. (4/30/17) 65. BECKLEY (CONT’D) I got put on his case after he got caught in Montana. There was a robbery, which was to be expected, and a chase, which I learned was also not unusual. And he got caught, because he always got caught. Now, the cops said that when they got to the showdown — he opened fire on them. He claimed he didn’t even have a gun, that it was his car backfiring. Which I believe was maybe half-true. He always had a gun on him but if you told me he’d never fired it in his life, I'd believe you. I remember, I sat down with him once and said, Forrest: surely there's a better way for a man in your position to make a living. And he said: brother, I’m not talking about making a living. I’m just talking about living. Against some of this dialogue we see the following:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest is driving, looking happy as can be. He looks into the rearview mirror and sees... POLICE CARS. An entire PHALANX of them, probably ten or twenty. Their lights flashing through the dust on the roa They look a little like UFOs. He wipes the sweat off his brow and squints against the h sunlight, and then he LAUGHS. EXT. HIGHWAY / FIELDS - FLASHBACK CONTINUOUS ill He veers off the highway, onto a little DIRT FARM ROAD cutting through a field. The car bumps wildly. It hits a ditch and in the tremendous JOLT, the TRUNK FLIES OPEN. Cold hard cash flies from out of the trunk. It flutters i the air like confetti - a cloud of green exhaust.  Goldenrod Rev. (4/30/17) 65A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest looks at this in dismay - that’s a mighty stash l to the wind back there. But he keeps going..  113 114 115 116 117 Blue Rev. (3/10/17) 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest also turns, off the dirt road and back onto pavem on the opposite side of the field. He steps on the gas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..-but that’s when he sees the STATE TROOPER CARS on the highway in front of him. Pulling into formation, forming BLOCKADE. They’ve got a spiked chain in the road and everything. He slams on the brakes, gives the wheel an epic spin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ++only to see the other cop cars pouring out of the field off that same dirt road, a few stray hundreds trailing af them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s the end of the line for old Forrest. Which is exactl what the SHERIFF shouts into a megaphone from 50 feet awa

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: End of the line, Forrest Tucker. Forrest agrees. He throws his car in park. And then he gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every cop instantly pulls their gun. The sound of a thous guns being pulled. A million kerchacks. Forrest grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets out of the car ..-lifting his hands high... ..-but then he forms a gun with his fingers... ..-points it... :+and pulls the invisible trigger.  118 Green Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 67. INT. JOHN HUNT’S HOUSE - NIGHT 118 Back to the present. John Hunt unlocks the door and returns home. He peeks into the kids room. They're asleep. He goes into the kitchen and opens the fridge and takes o beer. There’s a clock radio on the counter and he hits it, shuffling past the news until he finds some music. He sits there in the dark having a drink and listening to music, and then Maureen emerges from the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: You find him?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Sorta.

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: What’s that mean?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: I found out who he is.

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: He’s a guy. Who’s old. But used to be young. And he really likes robbing banks.

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: That’s it.

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: Just like you're a guy who’s a cop who's gonna catch him? John Hunt grins and sets his beer down and cranks up the radio.

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s late.  Green Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 67A.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Not that late.

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: The kids are asleep.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: They're fine. Let’s go out.

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Can we get a babysitter?

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: It’s one in the morning...

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: So? He takes her in his arms and starts to dance with her, ri there in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: What’s up with you?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: I’m just feeling like...I don’t know what I’m feeling. I’m just feeling something.

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: Don’t you need to call someone?  Green Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 68.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: To tell ‘em you know who he is?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Tomorrow. I’1l tell them tomorrow. Tonight he’s all mine. She laughs and they keep dancing. FADE TO BLACK. HOLD ON BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door chimes. John Hunt and Maureen walk into a very familiar-looking diner. They head to the counter, passing the waitress at the checkout stand.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Give me a second and we'll find a table for you...

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Can we just sit at the counter there?

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Absolutely. They sit down.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Is this where we sat?

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: I think it was that one.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Close enough. CAMERA ZOOMS PAST THEM.... +..to find Forrest and Jewel sitting in their usual booth sees John Hunt and is momentarily distracted.

dialogues.speaker: JEWEL
dialogues.text: Hey...  Green Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 68A.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: Hmmm?

dialogues.speaker: JEWEL
dialogues.text: You look like you’d drifted off to space. Forrest nods.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: You wanna get out of here?

dialogues.speaker: JEWEL
dialogues.text: We just ordered.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: No, I mean, like really get out of here. Take a trip somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: JEWEL
dialogues.text: Like what, a vacation?

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: Yeah. Jewel isn’t sure how to take this.

dialogues.speaker: JEWEL
dialogues.text: Oh...I don’t know. I’ve got the animals to take care of and -

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: But say that’s not a problem. Would you want to?

dialogues.speaker: JEWEL
dialogues.text: (with a smile) Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: Okay. And don’t worry - we can get out of here too. A short while later, John and Maureen are drinking milksh like two teenagers out on a first date at a soda counter.

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: I had this idea in my head that when you walked through the doors, everyone was gonna stand up and give you a round of applause. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 68B.

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you'd walk down the aisles all proud, sorta like - when I was little I would be writing a book report -

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Why’s it always come back to you and book reports? How many book reports did you write in school?

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: - and I’d imagine that there would be a little stage for me to stand on and the whole class would clap at the end. But no one cared. There was no stage and I just got up and read it and sat down and I did a good job and the day went on.  120 Green Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 69.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Well, that’s sad. And I got news for you. Everyone clapped. For me. Everyone clapped for me.

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: Well good for you.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Yep. How’s this taste?

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Lemme try, I don’t like mine. He uses his straw to take a sip of Maureen’s milkshake. W he pulls it out gets ice cream all over his shirt and tie She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Hunt is in the vestibule just outside of the men’s r looking at the mirror on the wall, trying to straighten h tie, which he’s just washed.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: Hey, didn’t I see you on TV? John Hunt turns and looks to his right and sees... .+.FORREST TUCKER, standing there in front of him. Dresse one of his flawless suits. Cool as a cucumber.  Yellow Rev. (4/4/17) 70. John Hunt looks like he’s seen a ghost. He recognizes Forrest... ...but Forrest doesn’t realize this.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: I thought so. With the - what do you call them - the gang, the Over The Hill Gang.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: You catch ‘em?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: You close?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Getting there.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: Can I help you with that? It takes John a moment to realize that Forrest is talking about his tie. Forrest has a twinkle in his eye as he reaches out, grabs tie and makes quick work of it, undoing the bad knot alre in place and quickly reworking it, completely unaware tha John Hunt knows exactly who he is.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Learned how to do this in Catholic school. Forrest tightens the knot.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There you go. Looking sharp. You got a gal with you?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah, I do. My wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 121 Green Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 0A.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: In my experience, looking sharp’1l get you a long way. You'll look like you know exactly what you're doing. Even when you don’t. He pats John on the shoulder and heads into the men’s roo Just before the door shuts...

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Forrest Tucker. Forrest turns.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know who you are. Forrest regards him for a moment, and then shuts the door John Hunt stands there for a moment... :+-and then snaps out of his momentary daze and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Hunt walks out of the vestibule just in time to see front door closing, with its little bell chime. Forrest a Jewel are nowhere to be seen. He sits down at the counter for a second. Puts his head i his hand and scrunches up his face like he has brainfreez

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: fer eee

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: What? John sits up, practically bleary-eyed, and looks towards restroom door. Forrest still hasn't emerged. John Hunt steels up some deeply rooted sense of righteousness, gets up from the table with fists balled u He HEADS BACK...

dialogues.speaker: 121B
dialogues.text: 122 Green Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 70B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTO the vestibule, where he OPENS the Men’s Room Door, only to find... It’s empty. Forrest has flown the coop. John looks to his left. Past the women’s room to... THE BACK EXIT. He hurries out, pushing the door open and stepping into..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands there in the back, under the solitary street li He’s completely alone. No sign of Forrest anywhere. INT. / EXT. FORREST’S CAR - NIGHT 122 Forest and Jewel are driving now. Silently.  123 124 125 126 127 Pink Rev. (3/24/17) 7. Jewel is watching Forrest. Wondering. He glances her way catches her. She doesn’t look down. Then he steps on the gas. His car shoots exuberantly down North Texas highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest fills up the gas tank. He goes to the little convenience store to pay. While she waits, Jewel glances at the glove compartment. She opens it and sees the GUN in there She stares at it. Her face tightens a bit. She shuts the glove compartment again before he returns. EXT. JEWEL’S HOUSE - NIGHT 124

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest pulls up outside Jewel's house. Any conversation or farewells or plans for future dates h already transpired. No more words necessary. She gets out of the car and slowly walks up to the front door. She stops here and there en route, turning around, looking back at Forrest, just to see if he really is stay where he is. Eventually, she makes it to her front door. She unlocks i goes inside and slowly, gently closes it, keeping an eye Forrest the whole time INT. JEWEL’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 125 Jewel shuts and locks the door. She leans against it for moment, thinking about what’s just transpired. INT. FORREST’S CAR - CONTINUOUS 126 Forrest is maybe having a similar thought. INT. JEWEL’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 127 Jewel waits a moment more. She can hear his engine idling outside. She opens the door again...  Pink Rev. (3/24/17) 71a. ...to find Forrest striding towards her.  128 129 130 Buff Rev. (5/8/17) 72. He walks right up to her and they kiss. The light from th house and the barn across the drive casts them in silhuce A romantic moment, cloaked in mystery. Still, no words are exchanged. He pulls away. His face comes into the light. He’s confid assured. She is not. But if he recognizes this, he doesn’t acknowl it. Instead, ever the gentleman, he tips his hat and stri away. The engine starts up, the car pulls away. Red tailights o her face. The door shuts for good. INT. JEWEL’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 128 Jewel walks deeper into the house. She goes to the stove and picks up the tea kettle. She goes to the sink and puts it under the faucet and tur it on. She’s so lost in thought that she doesn’t even notice tha the water is OVERFLOWING. She sets it down on the burner and then walks over to her table. She sits down there and looks out the window. INT. FORREST’S CAR - NIGHT 129 Forrest drives home. He rolls down the window. Letting the breeze ripple throu his hair once more. EXT. FORREST’S HOUSE - NIGHT 130 Forrest pulls up to his house. As he’s getting out of the car, he looks up at the house. Something is not right. TEDDY is sitting on the front porch. He stands as Forrest notices him.  Buff Rev. (5/8/17) 72n. Forrest is confused. He smiles a little bit and is about open his mouth to say something. And then a LIGHT TURNS ON BEHIND HIM.

dialogues.speaker: FBI AGENT SUMMERS
dialogues.text: Forrest Tucker, you are under arrest. Get out of the car!  131 132 133 Buff Rev. (5/8/17) 73. The house is surrounded by FBI AGENTS. They’re emerging f the shadows, getting out of unmarked cars, coming from ar the side of the house. FBI AGENT SUMMERS (CONT’D) Get out of the car with your hands up now! Teddy is aghast. There are agents rushing up to the porch slapping handcuffs on him... Forrest ducks back INTO THE CAR and KEYS THE IGNITION. FBI AGENT SUMMERS (CONT’D) Stop! Don’t - His engine BACKFIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A block away. GUNFIRE ERUPTS in the distance. Then the sound of a SCREECHING CAR. A moment later and Forrest's car, perforated with bullet holes on one side, ZOOMS PAST US. INT. FORREST’S CAR - CONTINUOUS 132 Forrest drives as fast as he can. Swerving around corners can hear sirens behind him. Somehow he manages to evade t He looks down. There’s BLOOD coming from somewhere. He’s hit in the arm. His front windshield is splintered from the gunfire. He c see. The view out the window is a kaleidoscope of light a shadow. EXT. FORREST’S CAR - CONTINUOUS 133

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls onto a busy road and quickly swerves over to the shoulder. He doesn’t waste a beat. He grabs his GUN from the glove compartment and gets out of the car.  134 135 Pink Rev. (3/24/17) 74. EXT. FORREST’S CAR / BUSY STREET - CONTINUOUS 134 He steps into oncoming traffic and waves down the first c he sees. The headlights flood around him. It’s a shitty old HONDA. A woman (SANDY) is behind the wh and her 8-year old son buckled into the backseat. She see the blood on him.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Oh my god, are you - what on earth happened? Are you hurt? Forrest thinks fast. Even as she’s trying to process the sight of this old man, Forrest is walking towards her, ar to the passenger side...

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: I need a ride, please, ma’am. I need to get to a hospital. He opens the door and shuts the passenger seat and pulls door shut.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Oh - okay...do you...oh my god... She sees HIS GUN now. She steps on the gas. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they speed off down the road, Sandy notices the sirens ringing all around her. She looks to Forrest, who's crouching down extremely low her seat. Too low for anyone else to see. She begins to realize exactly what’s going on. Her eyes fill with tears.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Please...my boy... It takes Forrest a moment to process these words. Then it occurs to him to look into the backseat. For the first ti he sees the LITTLE BOY back there. Scrunched nervously in corner, a few toy cars spread out on the seat beside him. The boy meets his gaze dead on.  136 137 138 139 140 Pink Rev. (3/24/17) 75. After a moment, Forrest turns back to the front, facing t open road ahead.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: Okay. Pull over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Honda drives away, leaving Sandy and her son in front a well-lit grocery store. The tail lights recede on their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Honda is parked somewhere now. Somewhere like a parki lot, on the side of a building. Forrest takes his tie and wraps his arm with it, pulling tight. Wincing as he does so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest drives. The sound of Jackson C. Frank’s Blues Run The Game come o

dialogues.speaker: JACKSON C. FRANK
dialogues.text: Take a boat to England, baby, Take a boat to Spain Where I have been and gone Wherever I’ve been and gone Wherever I have been the blues remain the same The song continues as he drives...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down the country road. Headlights cutting through the distance. The sky is starting to turn blue with the coming dawn. EXT. JEWEL’S HOUSE - DAWN 140 He pulls up to Jewel's house.  141 142 Blue Rev. (3/10/17) 76. Gets out, goes to the front door. Tries the handle. It’s locked. He raises his hand to knock... ...and then freezes. His hand drops. He stands there on the porch for a moment. Looking around trying to decide what to do next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He enters the stables and walks up to one of the horses. Dorothy Jean. He strokes her nose, whispering to her. She tosses her he and neighs at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rides her out of the stables, out into the pasture. He has a blanket pulled from the stables wrapped around h back. The sun is just beginning to come up. That Jackson C. Frank song is still going as he rides Dor Jean across the rolling fields of Jewel’s land. It seems to stretch out forever. Eventually he gets to a section of the wire fence that’s TORN DOWN and rides thro it. He rides down the center of a dried up river bed. Followi its bend. Then he climbs out of it and rides to the top of a hill. From here he can look out and see the land around him. It seems like he’s been riding much longer than he has. F like he shouldn’t be able to see where he came from. But no, he can still see Jewel’s house, like a tiny miniature, way down in the distance. And he can see the road...  143 Green Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 77. ..-and the line of POLICE CARS driving down it. Six or se of them, lights flashing, heading towards Jewel's house. He stops riding and watches them come. The song comes to an end. FADE TO BLACK. INT. BEDROOM - JOHN HUNT’S HOUSE - NIGHT 143 Maureen is in bed. She can hear John Hunt in the kitchen, talking on the pho

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Is he okay? (beat) Yes. Yeah, I understand. Thanks for letting me know. Goodnight. She hears the phone click. Hunt climbs in beside her, as quietly as he can.

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: (sleepily) What happened? Her voice has the sing-song quality of someone who’s not quite awake.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Well. They caught him.

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: They did?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: They found one guy, and that guy lead them to the next guy, and the next guy lead them right to his front door.

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ae  Green Rev. (mm/dd/yy) TIA.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Well. I guess he’s gonna go to prison.

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: Hmmmm. That’s too bad. Not what Hunt was expecting to hear. He leans back. Ponde this.  144 145 Pink Rev. (3/24/17) 78.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess so.

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry you didn’t catch him.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Don’t be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest lies in a hospital bed, in a room watched by a po officer. He looks rough. All bandaged up, with a tube in his nose. Some machine beeping away in the background. He’s just conscious enough to see John Hunt enter. There’s no need for words. It’s pretty clear Forrest isn’ any shape to hold a conversation anyway. Instead, John Hunt opens his wallet, pulls out a 100 DOLL BILL and sets it on Forrest’s bedside table. CAMERA PUSHES IN on the bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Jewel sits in a prison meeting area. A little table, in equal parts by fluorescents and sunlight. Brick walls, candy machine. Forrest sits opposite her. Looking old and disheveled. Slumped in a wheelchair. His prison garb hangs loosely fr his body. He appears very small.

dialogues.speaker: JEWEL
dialogues.text: So you lied to me about your name. He nods his head.

dialogues.speaker: JEWEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I guess you told me the truth about everything else, so...I shouldn't be so angry.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: I figured you knew.  Yellow Rev. (4/4/17) 79.

dialogues.speaker: JEWEL
dialogues.text: The detectives asked me that. If I knew. Or if I’d had even the faintest a clue.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: What'd you say?

dialogues.speaker: JEWEL
dialogues.text: I said of course not.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JEWEL
dialogues.text: Me too. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: JEWEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You had so much money. They said they pulled almost half a million dollars out of your floorboards? What were you going to do with it? Why on earth would you keep on... Her voice trails off. He shrugs, and then pulls something out of his pocket and gives it to her. It’s a few pages of lined notebook paper folded up like a letter.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: I wrote this up for you. She takes it and unfolds it. It’s a list.

dialogues.speaker: JEWEL
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: These are all the times I’ve broken out before. Jewel puts on her glasses and begins to read this catalog great escapes. Each one is numbered, with a year and a location. An impressive record of a life spent absconding Jewel puts on her glasses and begins to read...  Yellow Rev. (4/4/17) 79A. Eventually, she reaches the end of the list, but there’s more page. She turns it. There’s a number 17. And it’s space is blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 146 147 Green Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 80.

dialogues.speaker: JEWEL
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: I’m saving the best for last. He winks. She sets the list down.

dialogues.speaker: JEWEL
dialogues.text: Maybe...maybe you should just stay put. She puts her hand on his. FADE TO BLACK. INT. POLICE STATION - CAPTAIN’S OFFICE - DAY 145A Surprise mystery scene with Captain and John Hunt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two WEATHERED HANDS work the buttons of the shirt on a ch yellow prison jacket. The kind given to all prisoners upo their release.

dialogues.speaker: SOME YEARS LATER
dialogues.text: CAMERA FINDS Forrest's face in the mirror. Time has caught up with him, and then some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest steps out the front gate of the prison. Officiall and, for the first time in his life, legitimately - a fre man. He walks forward. He’s got a cane now to help support himself. He squints. Not used to the light, or the wide-open world Then he finds something to focus on. JEWEL stands there waiting for him.  Green Rev. (mm/dd/yy) 80a. 148 INT. JEWEL’S CAR - DAY 148 Jewel drives. Forrest sits beside her, looking at the wor go by.  149 150 151 Pink Rev. (3/24/17) 81. EXT. JEWEL’S HOUSE - DAY 149 They pull up to Jewel’s house. Forrest gets out.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: This the same place?

dialogues.speaker: JEWEL
dialogues.text: Same as ever.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: It looks different. Jewel’s dog trots out to them. The same dog, older, unabl run the way he used to. INT. JEWEL’S HOUSE - DAY 150 He enters the house. They're taking things slowly. He set his suitcase down. He sees a big framed photo of Jewel's horses on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: What about those guys?

dialogues.speaker: JEWEL
dialogues.text: They're gone. Just me and Indy now. For some reason, that takes the wind out of his sails a b INT. GUEST BEDROOM - JEWEL’S HOUSE - DAY 151

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forest sits down on the bed. Jewel sits down on the other side. In profile to him.

dialogues.speaker: JEWEL
dialogues.text: My bedroom’s right across the hall. If you need anything.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: JEWEL
dialogues.text: You can stay as long as you want. He leans forward, arms resting on his knees. She sits down next to him.

dialogues.speaker: JEWEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm glad you called me.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: I'm glad you picked up. INT. JEWEL’S HOUSE - DAY 151A Forrest stands on the staircase. The wall that was comple stripped last time he was here has been re-wallpapered... .++all except for one square, where the HOMEBUILDER’S NAM still exposed. A few scratches of pencil, 100 years old. Proof of a job well done. INT. JEWEL’S HOUSE - DAY 152 Forrest tries to pick out a melody on the piano. Indy lay next to him, trying to rest with eyes open in that way ol dogs do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest sits at a desk by a window. Outside BIRDS ARE CHIRPING and FLOWERS are blooming. He puts some paper int TYPEWRITER, rolls it forward. He types a few sentences. This is the story of the greatest bank robber in... He stops and looks out the window. It’s now SNOWING. He looks at his hands as they hover over the keyboard. Th ‘TREMBLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU: Forrest’s hand, STILL TREMBLING. Doctor GERRY BISCHO MD takes his hands and gently applies pressure to each finger, each joint.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR GERRY
dialogues.text: Do you feel anything there?

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR GERRY
dialogues.text: No pain or discomfort?  155 Pink Rev. (3/24/17) 82a.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: I don’t think so. It’s just...

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR GERRY
dialogues.text: We can do some x-rays, but I think what you’re looking at is typical osteoarthritis. This is relatively normal at your age. It’s just a sign of wear and tear. Forrest looks perturbed. This shouldn’t be perfectly norm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest and Jewel sit together in a MOVIE THEATER. Beam o light shooting over their heads. Forrest sinks into his chair a little bit, the screen twinkling in his eyes. For a moment he’s a LITTLE KID again, watching GANGSTER MOVIES in the theater. Watching Jimmy Cagney drive a fanc car, seeing Laurence Tierney pack two pistols.

dialogues.speaker: AHH
dialogues.text: 156 157 158 159 Pink Rev. (3/24/17) 83. He turns and catches Jewel looking at him, eyes shining i the dark. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest and Jewel leave the movie theater. They’ve only walked a little ways down the street when Forrest spots an ARMORED TRUCK pulling away from a nearby bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest sits down on the bed with a PHONE BOOK. He licks thumb and begins to page through it. Then he picks up the telephone and dials a number. INT. JOHN HUNT’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 158 Maureen answers the telephone as a TEENAGED TYLER rummage through the kitchen in the background.

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: FORREST, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hello...is John Hunt in?

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: He’s still at the office, can I ask * give him a message? *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He’s at the station?

dialogues.speaker: MAUREEN
dialogues.text: No, no, he hasn’t - he’s at the * DA’s office now. Can I ask who's * calling? *

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: I'll try him at the office. Thank * you. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up. He doesn’t notice Jewel in the doorway behin him.  Pink Rev. (3/24/17) 83a.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest and Jewel take an early evening walk down the str Autumn is setting in, and a wind blows the leaves about t  161 162 Pink Rev. (3/24/17) 84. They WALK for a while, to the end of the block, a long do shot, and then Forrest STOPS for a moment, staring out ah of them like he sees something headed his way. INT. JEWEL’S HOUSE - DAY 161 Jewel is asleep. Taking a nap. Forrest's hand touches her

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: Jewel. Wake up. She stirs, and awakens to see him kneeling beside her.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m gonna go out for a bit . You need anything? She smiles sleepily.

dialogues.speaker: JEWEL
dialogues.text: No. How long will you be gone?

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: Not long. INT. JOHN HUNT’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS 162 We find JOHN HUNT now. A little bit older. A little bit grayer. He sits in a gla walled office high above the city. His PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: John Hunt here.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hey John.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Yep. Who’s this? A long pause.  163 Goldenrod Rev. (4/30/17) 85. A gleam appears in John Hunt’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Forrest Tucker, is that you? (beat) I heard you got out.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: I’m out all right.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: I kept waiting to hear that you'd flown the coop but nothing. What happened, you get tired of climbing fences and digging tunnels?

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: I thought I was, but... His voice trails out.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT
dialogues.text: Well, I’m glad you’re out. You doing good? A long, long pause.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HUNT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Forrest? You okay?

dialogues.speaker: FORREST
dialogues.text: I'm about to be. With that, he HANGS UP THE PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts on his hat and walks away from the PAYPHONE and CROSSES THE STREET... ...heading straight towards a BANK. He disappears through the doors. CAMERA HOLDS ON THE BANK FOR A LONG TIME. Gradually, we begin to push in. There’s the faintest sound of commotion on the inside. We keep pushing, pushing...towards the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod Rev. (4/30/17) 86. And then, at the last second, the door opens, Forrest Tuc runs out and...

dialogues.speaker: THE END
